results.definition: the omission that is made when an editorial change shortens a written passage
weed out unwanted or unnecessary things
examples: We had to lose weight, so we cut the sugar from our diet

results.definition: cut down on; make a reduction in
examples: The employer wants to cut back health benefits

results.definition: the act of penetrating or opening open with a sharp edge
examples: his cut in the lining revealed the hidden jewels

results.definition: made neat and tidy by trimming
in baseball; a batter's attempt to hit a pitched ball
examples: he took a vicious cut at the ball

results.definition: (used of rates or prices) reduced usually sharply
lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
cut and assemble the components of
(used of grass or vegetation) cut down with a hand implement or machine
reduce in scope while retaining essential elements
the act of cutting something into parts
examples: his cutting of the cake made a terrible mess

results.definition: refuse to acknowledge
examples: She cut him dead at the meeting

results.definition: turn sharply; change direction abruptly
examples: The car cut to the left at the intersection

results.definition: be able to manage or manage successfully
examples: she could not cut the long days in the office

results.definition: mixed with water
a refusal to recognize someone you know
the act of shortening something by chopping off the ends
examples: the barber gave him a good cut

results.definition: (sports) a stroke that puts reverse spin on the ball
examples: cuts do not bother a good tennis player

results.definition: style and tailor in a certain fashion
with parts removed
a wound made by cutting
examples: he put a bandage over the cut

results.definition: create by duplicating data
cease, stop
examples: We had to cut short the conversation

results.definition: cut off the testicles (of male animals such as horses)
a piece of meat that has been cut from an animal carcass
make out and issue
a trench resembling a furrow that was made by erosion or excavation
a remark capable of wounding mentally
intentionally fail to attend
a distinct selection of music from a recording or a compact disc
examples: he played the first cut on the cd

results.definition: the division of a deck of cards before dealing
examples: he insisted that we give him the last cut before every deal
the cutting of the cards soon became a ritual

results.definition: (of a male animal) having the testicles removed
cause to stop operating by disengaging a switch
a canal made by erosion or excavation
allow incision or separation
an unexcused absence from class
examples: he was punished for taking too many cuts in his math class

results.definition: a share of the profits
examples: everyone got a cut of the earnings

results.definition: a step on some scale
examples: he is a cut above the rest

results.definition: discharge from a group
examples: The coach cut two players from the team

results.definition: dissolve by breaking down the fat of
divide a deck of cards at random into two parts to make selection difficult
examples: She cut the deck for a long time

results.definition: fashioned or shaped by cutting
fell by sawing; hew
examples: The Vietnamese cut a lot of timber while they occupied Cambodia

results.definition: (film) an immediate transition from one shot to the next
examples: the cut from the accident scene to the hospital seemed too abrupt

results.definition: form by probing, penetrating, or digging
examples: The sweat cut little rivulets into her face

results.definition: form or shape by cutting or incising
function as a cutting instrument
give the appearance or impression of
grow through the gums
have a reducing effect
have grow through the gums
hit (a ball) with a spin so that it turns in the opposite direction
make an abrupt change of image or sound
examples: cut from one scene to another

results.definition: make an incision or separation
make a recording of
examples: She cut all of her major titles again

results.definition: move (one's fist)
examples: his opponent cut upward toward his chin

results.definition: pass directly and often in haste
examples: We cut through the neighbor's yard to get home sooner

results.definition: pass through or across
penetrate injuriously
examples: The glass from the shattered windshield cut into her forehead

results.definition: perform or carry out
reap or harvest
record a performance on (a medium)
separated into parts or laid open or penetrated with a sharp edge or instrument
separate with or as if with an instrument
shorten as if by severing the edges or ends of
stop filming
the act of reducing the amount or number

results.definition: the style in which a garment is cut
